intro: Leandra nianga var. ovata, commonly known as the ovate leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate in shape, with a smooth texture and a dark green color, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to warm, humid climates.
